definition: surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: Xixia Tongguanshan India unearthed in 1983 for the objects.
sentences.chinese: 西夏铜官印1983年出土，为一级文物。

sentences.english: In early economies, governments would supply currency by minting precious metals with their stamp.
sentences.chinese: 在早期，国家铸造有官印的贵重金属作为货币。

sentences.english: You might find one in a court room or other state government building.
sentences.chinese: 你在法庭或者其他的州政府大楼里面就会看到官印。

sentences.english: Firstly, there are some characteristics about the appearance and material quality of office seal at Song dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 宋代官印在形质上和制度方面具有自己的特点。

definition: official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
golden seal/characters tattooed on a convict's face
sealed ribbon fastening correspondence (in former times)
seal impression/stamp/mark from a seal serving as signature

tiger tally (a two-piece object made in the shape of a tiger, used in ancient China as proof of authority. One half of a tally could be issued to a military officer and this would be matched with the other half when verification was required.)
signature (in grass-style writing)/symbol used in place of a signature (on a document, contract etc)
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
